caption.p: Phylogenetic relationship of novel sand flyâ€“associated phlebovirus Ntepes virus from Kenya (red bold text) in relation to other selected members of the Phlebovirus genus. A) RNA-dependent RNA polymerase; B) nucleocapsid protein; C) glycoprotein Gn; D) glycoprotein Gc. The phylogenetic trees were inferred based on complete large, medium, and small protein sequences, applying maximum likelihood analysis in PhyML version 3.0 ( http://www.atgc-montpellier.fr/phyml/versions.php) using the LG substitution model. Statistical support of the tree topology was evaluated by bootstrap resampling of the sequences 1,000 times. Sequences are identified by virus name and branch colors. Bootstrap values >70 are indicated at the nodes. Scale bar represents numbers of substitutions per site.
